sen.j: 紀 角または木 角（き の つの、生没年未詳）は、古墳時代中期の豪族。
sen.e: The date of birth and death unknown
KI no Tsuno (year of birth and death unknown) was a person of local ruling family in the middle of Tumulus period.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れに対応しました。補足しました。
sen.e: KI no Tsuno (year of birth and death unknown) was a person of local ruling family in the middle of Tumulus period.
Her surname was Sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary titles)
His surname was Sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary titles).
sen.cmt: Hisに訂正しました。ピリオド補足しました。
sen.e: His surname was Sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary titles).

sen.j: 武内宿禰の五男で、兄に羽田矢代、巨勢小柄、蘇我石川宿禰、平群木菟が、弟に葛城襲津彦らがいる。
sen.e: He was the fifth son of TAKEUCHI no Sukune and Yashiro HADA, Ogara KYOSEI, SOGAISHIKAWA no Sukune, Kiu HEGURI were his elder brothers and KATSURAGI no Sotsuhiko, amongst others were his younger brothers.

He was the fifth son of TAKEUCHI no Sukune and Yashiro HADA, Ogara KYOSEI, SOGAISHIKAWA no Sukune, Kiu HEGURI were his elder brothers and KATSURAGI no Sotsuhiko, amongst others were his younger brothers.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: He was the fifth son of TAKEUCHI no Sukune and Yashiro HADA, Ogara KYOSEI, SOGAISHIKAWA no Sukune, Kiu HEGURI were his elder brothers and KATSURAGI no Sotsuhiko, amongst others were his younger brothers.

sen.j: 紀氏の祖だが、紀氏は角から始まる系図を紛失してしまったため、現在では兄の平群木菟の系統とする架冒系図が一般的である。
sen.e: The Ki clan lost its family tree that showed the Tsuno origin thus it commonly used the family tree of his elder brother Kiu HEGURI.
The Ki clan lost its family tree that showed the Tsuno origin thus it commonly used the family tree of his elder brother Kiu HEGURI.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: The Ki clan lost its family tree that showed the Tsuno origin thus it commonly used the family tree of his elder brother Kiu HEGURI.

sen.j: 日本書紀によると応神天皇3年（272年、三国史記によると392年）、天皇に対し無礼な言動をとった百済の辰斯王を責めるべく兄たちとともに遣わされた。
sen.e: According to Nihon Shoki (Chronicles of Japan), the third year of Ojin Emperor (Year 272, Year 392 according to Samguk Sagi (History of the Three Kingdoms) he was sent to Kudara along with his elder brothers to condemn Shinshio (the 16th King of Kudara) who became insolent toward the Emperor.

According to Nihon Shoki (Chronicles of Japan), the third year of Ojin Emperor (272 or 392 according to Samguk Sagi (History of the Three Kingdoms) he was sent to Kudara along with his elder brothers to condemn Jinsa-wang (the 16th King of Baekje) who became insolent toward the Emperor.
sen.cmt: Year 削除しました。コンマ削除し、or補足しました。括弧内括弧を［］に訂正しました。辰斯王→Jinsa-wang [http://www.worldlingo.com/ma/enwiki/en/List_of_monarchs_of_Korea]百済→Baekjeに訂正しました。
sen.e: According to Nihon Shoki (Chronicles of Japan), the third year of Ojin Emperor (272 or 392 according to Samguk Sagi (History of the Three Kingdoms) he was sent to Kudara along with his elder brothers to condemn Jinsa-wang (the 16th King of Baekje) who became insolent toward the Emperor.

sen.j: その結果、辰斯王は自らの家臣に暗殺されたため、甥の阿莘王を王位につけ、帰国したという。
sen.e: He returned home after placing Ahino a nephew of Shinshio to replace him after he was assassinated by one of his vassals as a result.
He returned home after placing Asin-wang a nephew of Jinsa-wang to replace him after he was assassinated by one of his vassals as a result.
He returned home after placing Asin-wang a nephew of Jinsa-wang to replace him after he was assassinated by one of his vassals as a result.
